question: Who was the founder of the organisation "Abhinav Bharat" in 1906 at London?
explanation: To end British rule in India, a secret revolutionary society \"Abhinav Bharat\" was founded by VD Savarkar in 1906 at London. The society had two goals: to create through propaganda in Europe and North America an Indian public opinion in favour of nationalist revolution and to raise funds, knowledge and supplies to carry out such a revolution. It emphasised actions of self-sacrifice by its members for the Indian cause.
